name: Corporate Lifestyle Simulator
description: An isometric orgy of big smashy pixelart and big smashy chiptunes. Battle your way through corporate architecture and brain dead, buzzword-spewing, middle managers using office supplies as weapons...Fight back against the forces of tyranny and liberate your fellow coworkers from the oppressive evil that dominates them...
minimum_requirements: OS: 7 Processor: 2.4GHz Memory: 1 GB RAM Storage: 250 MB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: 7 Processor: 2.8GHz Memory: 1 GB RAM Storage: 250 MB available space

reviews.review_text: The title may be misleading when you see one of your friends playing it, and you just assume it's some sort of just regular boring desk job where you push pencils and type words on your fancy worky work machine but you would be ENORMOUSLY wrong!   This game is pretty hilarious and has lots of entertaining chatter as well as scenarios and it's own style.If you enjoy murdering zombies, hate boss like personas and want make a difference in your job , this is the game for you!

Great soundtrack (if you like chiptunes/dubstep), amusing 'cutscene' dialog, so-so mechanics. I enjoyed it a fair amount but the $/hours ratio (5:2) struggles a bit compared to some titles if you aren't picking up the soundtrack. I put this in my 'buy at 50% sale' bucket.

One of those games that I'm not really sure about if I should recommend it or not. If there was some kind of neutral rating I would have picked that.   In Corporate Lifestyle Simulator you're goal is to kill as many of your fellow (zombie) colleagues and rescue some who have not turned yet. There are quite a few weapons and office supplies (which can be used as a weapon) for you to use, after a few levels you will have to battle some kind of boss which all have different attacks and skills.  Mindlessly killing hordes of pixelated zombie accountants with a stapler is pretty fun however, after a few levels you'll be doing the same thing over and over again untill you meet one of the bosses.   Corporate Lifestyle Simulator is not a very hard game. You could rescue other employees, who then in return help you fight the undead but there is no real reason why you should rescue them. Yes, after each mission there's a scorelist to see if you killed all zombies and how many people you have rescued but that's about it. There are no leaderboards or achievements so personally I just don't care.   Overall the game is quite fun nd you will be having a laugh but you probably will only beat this game once (which should take max 2 hours) and never return to it. it's just not enough to fully recommend this game.
This game is a joke about itself - hypocritical and dull. Also very short, looks more like a flash game to me, and there are flash games a lot better than this. The soundtrack is nice though.  3/10

If you have ever worked in a corporation then this game may be a bit more funnier than normal. Enemies often quote such empty phrases as - don't work harder, work smarter. Also the arsenal of weapons is quite nice - you have stapler, fire extinguisher and deo spray flamer among others.  This is a shooter/action game with a bit of humor in it.   If you like such graphics style then you may want to check it out during some Steam Sale.

I was expecting something about a guy going postal and killing all his coworkers. Instead it's about a discount Seth Rogan saving his coworkers from zombies. I mean, it would be the same gameplay either way, but the route they took was extremely lighthearted. I mean, everything about the game is lighthearted and it just feels good to play.  Also, the music's great.  Also also sometimes it crashes :(

A fun game to play if you are bored and just need something to do, With the new music player on steam the sound track is definitely worth a purchase on its own without the game 36 songs and as far as I can see they are all pretty good.  The game itself is pretty decent, the way the people look is slightly strange as everyone looks like they have been in the local fast food place for a little too long, whether it is a way at looking at the obese population of society or just the people not being too good at making people you tell me, that doesn't really take away from the game at all and it is still enjoyable, the cutscenes between the levels are kind of awkward to watch as the voice acting isn't the best in the world but some of it is quite amusing to watch, if this bugs you you can skip them and get to the action quicker.  Wide variety of weapons available and with power ups appearing now and again to make it more enjoyable (flamethrowing chainsaw...I think yes) some ranged some melee so it does give you an option on how to play.  I personally bought the game on sale for £1.24 (Soundtrack edition) I would say the off sale price for the soundtrack is worth it more than the game but that is just an opinion. I would say if you don't have a powerful machine to run a lot of games at a solid 30 and suffer from frame drops (me currently) it is a decent game to pick up. If you also don't have tons of money as well as this I would suggest putting this game on the list
This is Exactly what sitting in an office all day will make you day dream about! 10/10

Just finished the game, mediocre at its best Lots of free flash games out there that are MUCH better than this Should've been a free flash game, fully regretted purchasing, I hope Steam sees this and deletes the game from my account so I have less chance of remembering this regret in the future
Sick game buy now very good ok
Accurately describes the corporate life, i should know im a bit of a ♥♥♥♥ myself.

Nice simple game with easy to use mechanics. 8-Bit art style is used well and enhances the arcade feel. Very fun to just sit in a corner and shoot staples at a horde of your 'co-workers'. Even more fun to throw the unturned coworkers into the horde as cannon fodder.  Overall great, fun, arcade-type game  8/10
one of the best elektro soundtracks in gaming history!

This is the type of game that you can just pick up and play at anytime of day, its great fun, there are some comedic moments and the soundtrack is THE BEST i have ever heard and is totally what makes this game so good. I would thoroughly recommend this!
Dumb fun, easy time killer. Super loud ♥♥♥ audio though, damn.

This is one of those games that's simple but has a schtick that runs thin too quickly. In this case, it's zombies saying corporate buzzwords while your character slings bad one-liners and stale Monty Python and the Holy Grail references.  Avoid, avoid, avoid.
Basicly workaholics with zombies

Is your boss a ♥♥♥♥?   Then this game is for YOU! Take on the coporate masses and save your coworkers from a surely painful death. Come on... We all know you are wasting away in your cubicle anyway. SYNERGY.
This game cracks me up
BEST SOUNDTRACK EVER :D 11/10! LOVE IT!! Gameplay is cool too :D

A little clunky finding the right sensitivity on controller, but great arena beat-em-up otherwise. A bit expensive for what it offers, but is good replayability with the endless mode.  Great soundtrack, too.  8/10
All games need this level of destruction.  Very nice isometric graphics, and charactors with a nice look to them.  Very fluid gameplay  10/10 would throw a printer at a corperate zombie again!

I reccommend it... For the Mobile Device. The reason being is that in the computer version, every time I complete a level, I have to exit the game and re-open the game. one time, it restarted me at the first level :P
It's hard being a regular dude working as an IT specialist in a company run by a bunch of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s.... but you'll manage.

Probably the most fun I've had playing a game in a while. Scratch that, it IS! Fantastic game, would recommend it to anyone with a PC. WELL worth the price, I think the price is perfect for attracting buyers and not over-charging them, as it is rather short, comparibly. However, if you really like the game, you'll have a lot of fun either replaying levels or playing endless mode. I love how you have a fricken' mech in the last level :D Epic end-boss, as with the soundtrack, which in my opinion makes the game twice as good. Thank you for making this game, keep up the good work!
Really short, I enjoyed it though. Mindless shooting is fun. Amazing story 10/10.
the zombies smell like tacos, 10/10

Corporate Lifestyle Simulator  Corporate Lifestyle Simulator lives up to its title. It most definitely is a corporate lifestyle simulator, slaughtering zombies of ranging managment levels with huge arsenals of weapons of mass destruction.  Pros:  - Funky pixel graphics - Entertaining gameplay - 'Endless' mode - Great sound - Soundtrack and voice acting  Cons:  - Not much really other than it can be difficult to get your head around the aiming process  Overall I recommend this as it puts a literally different perspective on pixel games, with a funky gameplay and visual style that is unique to its own.  ~ burgs.exe
really funny game and a good time blower!
I just *love* the theme on this game.  The game itself is pretty fun, although it controls better on mouse+keyboard than on a pad. Didn't notice any glaring technical issues.

As I'm playing this game, I realize a few things:  1) Nothing can ever bother me as long as I'm playing this game. 2) I have a lot of pent-up stress. 3) 100% of that stress can be released by simulating a zombie apocalypse and smashing all. of. the things.  The soundtrack is effective, punchy and relaxing simultaneously. The action is constant and satisfying. The gameplay is simple, yet rewarding. It's on sale right now, and I would say without any sort of qualification whatsoever that it's probably the very best deal on steam at time of writing.

If you want uncomplicated and inexpensive fun I'd reccomend it. Good humour, nice story and a lot of weapons to choose from (though cycling is done with '-' and '+' and there's no way to change it to 'Q' and 'E'. This is silly.)
If you work in an office and have violent fantasies about smashing your dull coworkers heads in with a telephone, buy this game.
Fun game to enjoy, soundtrack is also really good!
